detailsOfAchievement: International partner of Royal Life Saving Society (C), London and Member of International Life Saving Federation (ILS), London. â€¢ Encourage the young to learn First aid, Swimming and Lifesaving. â€¢ Teach them first aid procedures and life saving drills. â€¢ Introduce schemes to encourage them to qualify as first aiders, lifesavers and lifeguards. â€¢ Provide "First Aid" and prevent loss of life on land and waterfronts. â€¢ Recognize and reward good work done in first aid and life saving. â€¢ Collect and collate information on drowning accidents and rescue affected. â€¢ Investigate and analyze accidents to develop more effective rescue methods. Imparted BASIC LIFE SAVING courses throughout the state to the students, workers at site, drivers, conductors, cleaners, traffic police personnel, RTO, DTOs, other transport inspectors, learning license seekers, Scouts, NCC cadets etc. at the behest of Ministry of Shipping, Road Transport and Highways (MORT), Rajasthan State Road Transport Corporation (RSRTC), Jaipur Traffic Police, Rajasthan Urban Infrastructure Development Project (RUIDP) and other agencies. 3. Women Empowerment and Training: Guaranteed Job Assurance Scheme: Trust has been tied up with some big corporate exporters to develop skilled labour from un-marginalized sector of poor women across the state of Rajasthan. In first phase, Trust has identified groups from Chardiwari region of Jaipur City and Bagru to provide employment generation training and then would hand over this skilled labour to exporters to provide guaranteed job. 4. Publicity of Article 51-Human Duties on behalf of Rajasthan Human Rights Commission since 2007: More than 1 lac pamphlets containing information of Article 51-A â€“ Human duties in Constitution of India has been distributed across the state of Rajasthan since 2007. This is an ongoing activity of Trust and this article is been incorporated among all major publications of the Trust including The Pappu Road Sense Book. 5. PUBLICITY OF SUPREME COURT DECISION ABOUT RIGHT TO GET AN EMERGENCY AID AFTER AN ACCIDENT: Enforce various government and private departments to publicize the Supreme Court Verdict and display at various public places such a Hospitals, Schools, Police Thanas, Government and Private offices, PRIâ€™s etc. The Peopleâ€™s Trust has taken lead in this and placed posters of Supreme Court Decision to get an emergency aid at the time of an accident at buses of Rajasthan State Roadways Transport Corporation and various bus stands to create awareness among general public which is well taken by general public. detailsOfAchievement: Rajasthan Nat Samaj Sudhar Samiti was founded in the year 1996. Some of the concerned person of the community had thought to embark on the journey to remove the social stigma i.e. â€œsex workâ€ attached to the name of the community â€œNatâ€. Historically, the community has been involved with the work of providing sexual services for royal classes but with the end of the regime of different kingdoms the business diverted towards other sections of the society DETAILS OF THE WORK Self help group formation Some 50 self help groups are working in some 20 locations of the working area. Major issues which are covered in the self help group:- Account opening, general discussions with the members, timely reports on amount exit with the groups, personal hygiene, education for the children and goat and chicken rearing, Some visitors from Delhi based organization had visited the self help groups World AIDS day 8TH MARCH, 09 Major activities which were organized at all the locations of the work area are:- Essay writing, drawing and question raise to seek answer. Life skill program Major issues which are covered under life skill education:- Provided information, Physiology of body, adolescents changes in the body, coping with the tension, decision making, constructive thinking, problem solving, emotion management, and watching movies like Nanhe Jaisalmer. Sponsorship program It was undertaken at all the locations and following activities were undertaken in the work of area:- To make them understand the sponsorship program, children weight and height were taken, essay competition, poetry and drawing competition. Tuition prgramme Tuition centers were developed at all the locations to provide basic education to the children and adolescents Following subjects were covered:- English and mathematics and Hindi grammar Youth Clubs meetings It was undertaken at all the locations and following activities were undertaken with the youth clubs:- Youth group accounts were opened, loan repayment reports, some failed to pay it, on unemployment and on cricket trophy competition Meeting of sex workers It was undertaken at all the locations and following activities were undertaken with the youth clubs Information on HIV/AIDS, Sexual transmitted infection, to test the status of the blood, infection due to poor hygiene habits, personal hygiene, family planning, on police raids, Immunization and distribution of condoms Survey At all the locations surveys based on some points like, condom demand, health inputs and incomes education level were carried out to design the work as per the requirements of the community. Child care centers It was undertaken at all the locations and following activities were undertaken with the centers:- Hindi and English alphabets, health drinks, tuition of the students, competition on handicraft items making, sports competition and Distribution of stationary items on the centers. Care of PLWHA Fulfillment of Nutrition requirements of HIV infected persons on monthly basis Taking HIV infected persons to the ART centers:- Some 25 plus HIV infected persons were taken by the staff members to the ART centers in Jaipur to took the medicines. The staff members had counseled them and held meetings with the families of the infected persons. Medical camps It was undertaken at all the locations the details of which are given below:- Duration- 2- 4 hours For treatment of general ailments some 30 medical camps were organized in the project area. General ailments which were treated are- Fever, cold, cough, vomiting, pain in stomach, Diarrhea, itching. Summer camps Topics discussed:- Creation of earth Creation of human beings Discussion on god Singing Training of volunteers of organization Some two trainings were organized for some 30 volunteers of the organization in the district of Ajmer. Major issues covered under the trainings:- Issues related to HIV/ AIDS, Sexual transmitted infection, self help group formation and life skill education
